dialog.warning-cannot-undo: This action CAN NOT UNDO. Are you sure you want to proceed?

playlist-manager.title: Playlist Manager
playlist-manager.description: You can manage your playlists here

playlist-item-browser.title: Playlist Item Browser
playlist-item-browser.description: You can browse your playlist items here

about-section.title: About Playlist Manager For YouTube (PMFY)
about-section.description: Everything you need to know about Playlist Manager For YouTube

what-is-youtube-playlist-manager.title: What is Playlist Manager For YouTube
what-is-youtube-playlist-manager.content: Playlist Manager For YouTube is a web application that allows you to manage your YouTube playlists. You can copy, shuffle, merge, and delete your playlists and playlist items.

how-to-use.title: How to Use
how-to-use.content: Simply sign in with your Google account, and you can start managing your playlists after you select playlists you want to manage.

disclimer.content: The Playlist Manager For YouTube is developed by <1>{{dev}}</1>. The application is not affiliated with YouTube or Google. The application uses YouTube Data API v3. See more details on <2>Terms and Privacy</2>.

content.first: The Playlist Manager For YouTube uses YouTube API Services. By using the application, you agree to the <1>YouTube's Terms of Service</1> and <2>Google's Privacy Policy</2>.
content.second: The application is not affiliated with YouTube or Google. We do not collect, refresh or store any YouTube API data on our servers. The application uses YouTube Data API v3 to manage your playlists.
content.third: The application uses the YouTube API service to fetch playlists and playlist items, as well as to add, delete, and update them. These operations are combined to perform actions such as copying, shuffling, merging, and deleting playlists.
content.forth: We accept no responsibility or liability for any damages, losses, or consequences that may arise from the use of this application. Use of this application is entirely at your own risk.

how-to-revoke.title: How to Revoke
how-to-revoke.content: By clicking the 'Sign out' button, you can immediately revoke the permissions you granted us to access your YouTube account. You can also revoke access by visiting <1>myaccount.google.com/connections<1>
